Flex-a-Size Paper Towels, Huge Roll, 12 Count = 30 Regular Rolls', 'Amazon Brand - Presto! Flex-a-Size Paper Towels, Huge Roll, 12 Count = 30 Regular Rolls']
Text:
["
  Delivery was fast; the product was as described; the quality is good. However, for the money I paid (and my situation) this was not a good value. (In the picture, Amazon's product is on the left; on the right is a product from a big-name bulk retailer.) I can buy paper towels similar to Amazon's quality and size at my local supermarket for less money. This product would be good for a busy family on auto-subscribe or someone who can't easily get to a store for whatever reason.
", '
  These paper towels are a really crummy and are priced ridiculously high. It pains me to have to write a bad review, because I am one of Amazons biggest fans! But, they have really missed the mark on these. I can get the same amount of Bounty rolls for 1/4 of the price also from Amazon, which I recommend that people do instead of getting the Presto brand.
', "
  We (shamefully) go through a lot of paper towels. The cheap ones aren't worth the money so I always look for coupons for Bounty or Viva, large bulk packs. Presto! popped up on my app and I compared prices at different stores for the name brands. I compared length, package content, etc. As much as I love Amazon, I took a chance. I love these towels. They are strong and absorbent. If someone didn't see the packaging they wouldn't know it was a big overpriced store brand. I highly recommend these towels. I put the toilet paper on subscribe and save as well, I will review on Jan. 4th!
", '
  Overall these paper towels are comparable to competing brands. Never left a review before but was compelled to given that this is a quality assurance issue and these towels are by no means that cheap. The 12 rolls are packaged in 6 packs. One of the 6 packs had one roll that was shorter and less bulkier than the rest! I know Amazon can continue to do better.
', "
  While the smaller sheets are meant to save money, the perforations that separate sheets don't work well. As a result, we often get 3 sheets instead of 1. So, we are now spending more money on paper towels instead of less. Disappointing!
", "
  I wanted to give these a try because many reviewers compared them to Bounty, which I find to be the best for the kitchen. Presto is wonderful and if I didn't see the label I would think they were Bounty. A great paper towel at a bargain price!
", "
  I should have stuck with our usual purchase of [...] Select-A-Size.  But one never knows--sometimes, generic brands work just as well.  Unfortunately for us this was not the case this time.  Amazon Brand - Presto! Flex-a-Size Paper Towels are much thinner than [... brand] and also much less absorbent.  Amazon's version doesn't hold up well whilst wet (e.g. rinsing dishes), and takes two to three times as many sheets to clean up a spill compared to a single Select-A-Size sheet. Will never purchase again, do not recommend.As of June 29, 2019 I've updated this review by redacting the brand name that makes Select-A-Size paper towels and I wanted to add this last note: Amazon's brand does preform better than Target's generic brand.  Amazon's is thicker and more absorbent than Target's attempt at the same product (Target's version is so thin it rips up whilst just trying to tear a sheet off).  So if you or your household's go-to paper towel is Target's, Amazon's version is an upgrade.  But if your household's go-to is [...'s] Select-A-Size I'd strongly recommend sticking to it, if possible.
", '
  I thought I liked them until I realized that with these paper towels it now consistently takes 3 half sheets to dry my hands after washing them whereas with Bounty 2 half sheets were sufficient. This adds up in cost and has been causing us to empty the waste basket in the bathroom more frequently. Therefore I conclude that they are not as absorbent. Maybe it is not fair to compare an economy paper towel to Bounty, but Bounty is what we have almost always used prior to trying this Amazon Brand.
', '
  2x the expense of Costco Kirkland paper towel.Slightly smaller rolls than Costco Kirkland paper towel.
', "
  Have had to order these after my regular B brand was unavailable locally, and have been very disappointed in them. I think they end up being a little cheaper per section of towel, but I have to use more of them as they're not as absorbent and don't last as long.Fine in an emergency, but nowhere near as good as my regular brand.
", "
  Poor value. Quality and quantity not as expected.  I'll have to use this product but I will be extremely wary of Amazon products.  Kind of like No Name products.
", '
  These are the BEST paper towels we have had .. in 40+ years of buying paper towels.  They are better than the expensive brands. We like best that they are soft and very absorbant. We wont be buying anything else from now on.
', '
  They are ok, but not as thick or absorbent as Bounty.
']

Title: ['Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 12 Family Rolls = 30 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 12 Family Rolls = 30 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 12 Family Rolls = 30 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 12 Family Rolls = 30 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 12 Family Rolls = 30 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 12 Family Rolls = 30 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 12 Family Rolls = 30 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 12 Family Rolls = 30 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)']
Text:
['
  Beware the “Quick Size” ARE NOT THE SAME AS THE “SELECT-A-SIZE”! I’ve ordered cartons of the Bounty Select-A-Size paper towels in the “Family 2 rolls/package” from Amazon for several months now and been very happy. When I placed my most recent order, there was a message on Amazon’s webpage that said “this item has been replaced with a newer model”. Unfortunately the “newer model” has 15 fewer sheets/roll and costs $1.02 more/carton. The only way to distinguish between the original Bounty rolls and the “newer model” Bounty rolls is that the original ones say “Select-A-Size” on the package and the “newer model” packages say “Quick Size”.  This a very disappointing development from both Bounty and Amazon!
', '
  The Grocery Store Shrink Ray strikes again. These "family" rolls were substituted in for the "Huge" rolls I had always been purchasing with my Bounty Dash button, and these rolls are about 10% smaller for the exact same price. The only saving grace? These are the same awesome quality Bounty paper towels that they're always been - just there's less of them. I will be retiring my Dash button and I will NOT be purchasing these again.
', '
  These are NOT the select-a-size that I like and rebuy.  Each sheet is smaller and there are fewer on the roll than the Select-a-size Bounty.  Think that promoting these as a special for prime members is misleading.  I will not buy these from Amazon in future but will return to Target or Walmart to buy them.
', "
  I thought at first I just got a bad batch of these where the perforation setting was off when they were manufactured or something. I couldn't WAIT to get rid of that batch! Every time I'd go to tear a towel off it would stop 3/4 of the way down, unspool several unintended sheets from the roll, and then tear off the corner. Every. Damn. Time. I just finished the last of that box thank God and got my new shipment but I was horrified to find the new batch DOES THE SAME THING. I've never had this issue with bounty towels from anywhere else, but I'm about to throw 11 good rolls in the garbage and switch to Brawny, Viva, Scott's, Anything just to not be annoyed on a daily basis!
", "
  I ordered Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels 12 Family Rolls. As other reviewers have stated, I ordered a similar product before via Amazon. I was happy with the product that I received. This time I just received what I have pictured. 15 rolls of Regular Size Sheets. At this point I don't know whether I actually have more or less paper towels overall. I am not happy with the Regular Size Sheets. Interestingly product came from Sam's Club. Box was marked Sam's Club.
", '
  Paper towels are good not as large as I thought they would be by the description and they also were $7 cheaper the day after I bought them that really made me mad probably will not buy again
', '
  I usually love this Bounty. But since they changed it to ‘quick size’ the quality has been lacking. I’ve had a hard time tearing sheets and this last set I got is noticeably less thick. I can squeeze the whole roll and it’s still smaller than the previous pack I bought. They say on the package the same amount of sheets. But something is really lacking. The thickness, absorbency and quality. Shame Bounty. I hope it goes back to better quality!!!
', '
  These came in tissue boxes marked Kleenex. Clearly inferior for the purpose of paper towels.
']

Title: ['Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 16 Family Rolls = 40 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 16 Family Rolls = 40 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 16 Family Rolls = 40 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 16 Family Rolls = 40 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 16 Family Rolls = 40 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 16 Family Rolls = 40 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 16 Family Rolls = 40 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 16 Family Rolls = 40 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 16 Family Rolls = 40 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 16 Family Rolls = 40 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 16 Family Rolls = 40 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 16 Family Rolls = 40 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)']
Text:
['
  This is how the box showed up at my house. This is unacceptable.
', '
  Beware: "family size" is NOT equal to the "huge size" we all love.Didn't believe the reviews myself, but when I unpacked the box the rolls were noticeably lighter. We go through these twice as fast as the huge size, which is a shame because it means we spend more time restocking and breaking down packing boxes.I encourage everyone to write a review so that Amazon and Proctor & Gamble bring back the Bounty Huge size"! It has got to be the most ordered product on Amazon that they mucked with.
', '
  Cannot use in the kitchen.
', "
  I ordered 16 rolls of paper towels in July and the first 8 were fine but the second eight were completely ususable.  They have lint or dust or something all over them and can't be used.  A waste of money!  Will Amazon make good on these last eight paper towels or should I send them back or what?
", '
  I've been buying my Bounty papertowels at Sam's club for years. I've notice that Sam's now calls them "jumbo" when they are smaller than they used to be but are the same price. I purchased these just so see if they were bigger and they are. These are much bigger and thicker than the ones I've been wasting my money on at Sam's club. I will be subscribing to get these ones.
', '
  I am forever running out of paper towels so decided to order these family rolls. The 16 pack takes up quite a bit of room so be prepared to find a place to store them but last so much longer than the smaller ones, that it is worth it.
', '
  Best and strongest paper towel. Get pricing for a name brand.
', '
  I love having the paper towels delivered at my door.  I can bypass the paper towels and toilet paper isle at the grocery store.  Love the product!
', '
  Excelente producto, son muy absorbentes
', '
  Buen producto. Lo malo es el envio. Demasiado caro
', '
  El empacado es muy bueno. Es un excelente producto!
', '
  Excelente producto precio vs calidad
']

Title: ['Seventh Generation Toilet Paper, Bath Tissue, 100% Recycled Paper, 12 Rolls (Pack of 4) (Packaging May Vary)', 'Seventh Generation Toilet Paper, Bath Tissue, 100% Recycled Paper, 12 Rolls (Pack of 4) (Packaging May Vary)', 'Seventh Generation Toilet Paper, Bath Tissue, 100% Recycled Paper, 12 Rolls (Pack of 4) (Packaging May Vary)', 'Seventh Generation Toilet Paper, Bath Tissue, 100% Recycled Paper, 12 Rolls (Pack of 4) (Packaging May Vary)', 'Seventh Generation Toilet Paper, Bath Tissue, 100% Recycled Paper, 12 Rolls (Pack of 4) (Packaging May Vary)', 'Seventh Generation Toilet Paper, Bath Tissue, 100% Recycled Paper, 12 Rolls (Pack of 4) (Packaging May Vary)', 'Seventh Generation Toilet Paper, Bath Tissue, 100% Recycled Paper, 12 Rolls (Pack of 4) (Packaging May Vary)', 'Seventh Generation Toilet Paper, Bath Tissue, 100% Recycled Paper, 12 Rolls (Pack of 4) (Packaging May Vary)', 'Seventh Generation Toilet Paper, Bath Tissue, 100% Recycled Paper, 12 Rolls (Pack of 4) (Packaging May Vary)', 'Seventh Generation Toilet Paper, Bath Tissue, 100% Recycled Paper, 12 Rolls (Pack of 4) (Packaging May Vary)', 'Seventh Generation Toilet Paper, Bath Tissue, 100% Recycled Paper, 12 Rolls (Pack of 4) (Packaging May Vary)', 'Seventh Generation Toilet Paper, Bath Tissue, 100% Recycled Paper, 12 Rolls (Pack of 4) (Packaging May Vary)', 'Seventh Generation Toilet Paper, Bath Tissue, 100% Recycled Paper, 12 Rolls (Pack of 4) (Packaging May Vary)']
Text:
['
  I’ve been using this TP for years, willing to pay a little more for the healthier alternative. (I even liked it so much that when my local stores stopped carrying the larger quantity packages I started ordering them online.) I just received my new order and there’s much more than the packaging that has changed. The paper feels and looks much thinner. It looks and feels like the paper has been rolled much more loosely to give the appearance of having the same diameter as the old rolls. I am including pictures of one of my old SG rolls next to a new one. It is also a bit stiffer and more rough. I am very disappointed and will be looking for a different brand to order next time.
', "
  So we've purchased this item through Subscribe & Save for over a year.  At some point this year, the wife & I noticed that the product had changed.  It was never fluffy/cushiony/pillowy - frankly, it wasn't that soft, but it was sturdy, recycled, septic-safe and wasn't the dingleberry creator that it has now become. And therein lies the problem friends - 7th Generation has changed the formula and has added cushiony/softness, but at the expense of: 1) losing sturdiness - the aforementioned dingleberry issue and 2) there are now less sheets per roll.  What are we to do.  Who wants to spend time researching TP?  We don't even want to spend time getting at the store, hence the subscribe and save.  Anyhow, we are cancelling our S&S order and now back to the drawing board for a TP that will be similar to the original formula.
", '
  This is not the same product as used to be sold as SG toilet paper a few months ago.  Besides the fact that the quantity and packaging are different, the quality of the paper is much worse than it used to be--not nearly as absorbent, and much rougher.  I noticed significant price changes on this website with this and the comparable product from GF in both directions in the last few months, almost like the change in this product has caused significant market instability.  At this moment, I will no longer be purchasing this from SG but instead will revert to the comparable product from GF as it is currently of much better quality and only slightly more expensive.
', "
  It does not dissolve. AT ALL. It clogged our main line in our home and we had to pay a plumber $300 to unclog it. He pulled out the clog and it was literally a bunch of toilet paper. Please don't buy this. You're not doing the environment any favors with this toilet paper.
", "
  Do I love that they're recycled and not bleached with chlorine? Yes.Is the actual paper quality good? Absolutely.Can I speak to whether or not the price is fair? No. I have no idea the costs it takes to make such a product when it's definitely not mainstream.Here's the problem I have, and the reason this didn't get a sweeping five-star rating as it otherwise would have: there's about half the toilet paper on each roll as you'd expect. I don't know if they did this (wrapped it so loosely) to try to make it fluffier or what, but when you pay this kind of money for something when you really can't afford it because you're trying THAT HARD to not trash the environment, and you get these chintzy little rolls... it doesn't give you the best feeling.Having said that, be aware of your limited options when you go shopping for a product like this. There are like, what, two of decent quality and slightly reasonable cost here on Amazon? And they're all expensive. So yes, if you like the sound of this product, buy it. The quality is good. Just be prepared for what you're going to get.
", "
  It seems as though Seventh Generation is constantly reducing the amount of paper on these rolls. They last for a shorter and shorter period of time. I'm beginning to feel ripped off by Seventh Generation (but not their paper towels, those quantities seem fine and consistent.)Is Seventh Generation taking advantage of those of us who wish to help mitigate our negative impact on the earth?  If I have to keep buying more and more toilet paper, AM I HELPING THE ENVIRONMENT?You may wish to look for another socially responsible toilet paper company. If you find one, let me know!
", '
  We have been using this recycled toilet paper exclusively for several years now.PROS:--It is nice and soft. I have used recycled TP that felt like you were wiping with sand paper or packing paper. This TP is nice and soft.--It's absorbent. In fact, it is ironically MORE absorbent than expensive cushy brands like Charmin. Granted, Charmin is super soft, but it kind of slides along your tushy without accomplishing as much as this toilet paper. We actually prefer Seventh Generation TP to Charmin for that very reason. It works better!--Because it is thinner (but not too thin!), it is not going to clog your toilet the way Charmin can. And does.--You get to tell people you use "recycled toilet paper"! Think about it...--Environmentally friendly!CONS:--None.So, it's environmentally friendly and it works better than pricy brands. What are you waiting for?? :)
', "
  Not all recycled toilet paper is created equally! I have been using recycled toilet paper for about a decade and I have tried almost all the brands. I've used Seventh Generation for the past few years and was recently reminded how great this brand is. About a month ago I ran out of the Seventh Generation toilet paper and decided to purchase the generic brand from a local grocery store (Simple Truth) because my usual shipment of Seventh Generation (from Subscribe & Save) wasn't due to be shipped for another week. This was a huge mistake! When I got home I was promptly reminded how bad recycled toilet paper can be! The other brand is the roughest toilet paper I have ever experienced and does not come close to comparing to the softness of Seventh Generation.Seventh Generation's recycled toilet paper is SO soft and I love that it iss unbleached and chemical free. My Subscribe & Save shipment is due to arrive next week and I really can't wait! I highly recommend!
", '
  I should have expected this product to be wrapped in plastic based on the picture, but I was still disappointment when it turned up in so much disposable packaging. I would love if Seventh Generation would go the paper wrapping route like many bulk supply companies do for restaurants/ hotels/ etc. It feels like the environmental benefits of the product are negated by the plastic packaging...
', '
  I am very chemically sensitive and my skin is no exception. This paper is the only one so far I have found to not irritate my skin especially in such a sensitive area.
', '
  This is a great price for the product received.  It’s also softer than some of its competitors but still could use some improvement.  I do think that it’s thick and strong enough though and we’ve never experienced any clogging issues.
', '
  bought a few cases on sale to trydisappointed b/c it falls apart too quickly (compared with my preferred product - charmin ultra strong).stuck with over 100 rolls to finish...
', '
  Works great for the rv. A little pissed that it was over 20 bucks cheaper 2 days after i purchase a pack. Should have sent it back right away.
']

Title: ['Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 8 Family Rolls = 20 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 8 Family Rolls = 20 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 8 Family Rolls = 20 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 8 Family Rolls = 20 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 8 Family Rolls = 20 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 8 Family Rolls = 20 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 8 Family Rolls = 20 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 8 Family Rolls = 20 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)', 'Bounty Quick-Size Paper Towels, White, 8 Family Rolls = 20 Regular Rolls (Packaging May Vary)']
Text:
["
  There are 8 family size rolls of bounty paper towels. The first picture shows the paper towels I received in my order.  The second picture compares the size of bounty family size rolls (left) the largest of the two rolls and bounty large size rolls (right).  When I was ordering these paper towels I didn't know what size the rolls were and how to compare.  Hopefully this helps someone.  The price from Amazon is comparable to buying from any brick and mortar store at the time I purchased.
", '
  Bought two weeks ago and came back to see about ordering again, but not at an 80% price increase...
', '
  I absolutely detest the way these paper towels FEEL and will not be buying them again unless they all that’s available.  It’s like they have a layer of chlorine on top of them or something.  I bought them instead of Brawny paper towels because I only wanted a certain quantity of paper towels and Amazon doesn’t offer that same quantity of Brawny paper towels for delivery.  Every time I touch these Bounty substitutes I am reminded that I can’t stand them.
', '
  I love these paper towels! Super absorbent and the rolls are huge - they last forever so I feel like I’m getting more for my money. The small sheets are the perfect size to use as a napkin or clean up a spill
', '
  These are super! I used to buy the budget brand  paper towel from our family dollar store and wow! These are such an improvement! So much thicker, softer, more absorbent and I love the select a size.  The price is the same as the budget brand so I am very happy!
', '
  We love Bounty! Three four kids, 2 adults, 2 dogs, and one baby in this house. Bounty keeps up with our messes, and of course we need A LOT so buying in bulk is even better. This is very good for the price, and I buy this package each month!
', '
  Don’t buy the feels like a Brillo pad  They are not real bounty!!
', '
  Not as strong as I usually buy from Sams Ckub
', '
  Es el mejor papel de cocina, seca perfectamente todo.
']

Title: ['Brawny Tear-A-Square Paper Towels, 12 = 24 Regular Rolls, 3 Sheet Size Options, Quarter Size Sheets, 12 Count, 12 Count (Pack of 1)', 'Brawny Tear-A-Square Paper Towels, 12 = 24 Regular Rolls, 3 Sheet Size Options, Quarter Size Sheets, 12 Count, 12 Count (Pack of 1)', 'Brawny Tear-A-Square Paper Towels, 12 = 24 Regular Rolls, 3 Sheet Size Options, Quarter Size Sheets, 12 Count, 12 Count (Pack of 1)', 'Brawny Tear-A-Square Paper Towels, 12 = 24 Regular Rolls, 3 Sheet Size Options, Quarter Size Sheets, 12 Count, 12 Count (Pack of 1)', 'Brawny Tear-A-Square Paper Towels, 12 = 24 Regular Rolls, 3 Sheet Size Options, Quarter Size Sheets, 12 Count, 12 Count (Pack of 1)', 'Brawny Tear-A-Square Paper Towels, 12 = 24 Regular Rolls, 3 Sheet Size Options, Quarter Size Sheets, 12 Count, 12 Count (Pack of 1)', 'Brawny Tear-A-Square Paper Towels, 12 = 24 Regular Rolls, 3 Sheet Size Options, Quarter Size Sheets, 12 Count, 12 Count (Pack of 1)', 'Brawny Tear-A-Square Paper Towels, 12 = 24 Regular Rolls, 3 Sheet Size Options, Quarter Size Sheets, 12 Count, 12 Count (Pack of 1)', 'Brawny Tear-A-Square Paper Towels, 12 = 24 Regular Rolls, 3 Sheet Size Options, Quarter Size Sheets, 12 Count, 12 Count (Pack of 1)']
Text:
['
  My 76yo father was visiting from out of town and went to grab a piece of paper towel from the holder. Now, he already uses the pick-a-size variety at his home, so you'd think that tear-a-square wouldn't be a huge stretch, right?Wrong.He was baffled. Baffled, I tell you! "What on Earth is this new-fangled contraption? What would you need such a tiny piece for?"So, I rattled off they many uses: dinner napkins, coasters, polishing silverware, purse napkins (the ladies know what I'm talking about), homemade wet wipes to keep in your purse, make-up remover towelettes, something to blow your nose with when you're out of kleenex but don't want to waste a whole paper towel, and so, so much more.What did he do after that explanation? He grabbed thirty sheets and stalked off calling me a crazy millennial. For the record, I'm forty, but I don't think the Boomers care anymore.All I know is that I'm so glad that Amazon put these back on Subscribe & Save. I can't live without my tiny sheets of Brawny Paper Towel! XOXOXO
', '
  They do paper towel things really well.  They dry my hands after I wash them.  They wipe up beer when I spill it.  And you can tear them down to half as small as other size-adjustable paper towels.  If you are looking for paper towels, these are them.
', '
  By my firm belief that neither paper towels nor the truth can be stretched, the seller on Amazon claims that this product can magically be doubled by the company logic that since each approx. 11 inch sheet has a serrated horizontal and vertical tearing line, by tearing each sheet into an 11 inch  X  5 1/2 " you automatically get double the number of  sheets and a package of 6 rolls provides double the number sheets so abra -cadabra now you have 12rolls for the price of 6 rolls, come on now, pulling a rabbit out of a hat, is far more magical. For this failed attempt at chicanery, the Seller has earned one bright rated star. Shame, shame ! This attempt to mislead Amazon customers is not worthy of a large company as Brawney ?
', "
  I cant believe that I'm writing  a review on paper towel but these are the best we've used and our repeat orders prove it.  I consider myself budget aware and numerous times I've been distracted by the weekly specials at the local store on paper towels only to find that I use twice as much, twice as fast.  The Brawny tear-a-square towels are firstly very absorbent, secondly, because you can rip off a small square they are extremely economical.  I can't count the number of times in the past that I've torn off a whole sheet of paper towel just to wipe a drop of sauce from the counter.
", "
  I am thrilled with the fast delivery and overall quality of the Brawny Tear-A-Square Paper Towels.  I love that you can tear them into quarter sheet sizes, which makes them a great value. Especially if you cannot find toilet tissue at this time. I haven't tried it yet, but it is an option in an emergency.  Yes, I paid more than usual in this time of crisis, but I wasn't gouged and feel very grateful it was available on Amazon. i was able to purchase 2 cases for my home and office. I got LUCKY!**  If you found this review to be helpful at all, please take a moment and click the button below to let Amazon know. Thank you so much 😊 **
", "
  These were the only paper towels I found in stock and so gave them a try.  I usually get Sparkle and here's my comparison:PROS -TEXTURE AND ABSORBENCY -I LIKE both Sparkle and Brawny, but like Brawny better.SIZE OF ROLL - GOOD SIZE roll for price.SHEET SIZE CHOICE - I REALLY like I can tear a little or a lot.  BRAWNY gave me more options.  Sometimes I just need a LITTLE piece and BRAWNY lets me take just a bit, a small sheet or more.COST - Pretty comparable, but depends which is on sale.  Happy with the size of the rolls and the price.I would happily use Brawny if it and Sparkle are the same price.
", '
  I used to only use Brawny. I clean houses so I’m always needing paper towels. I had them on auto ship and 2x already, they’ve been out of stock and couldn’t be delivered. And I understand that can happen but what really irks me is the quality now. The quality actually just kept getting worse with every shipment. I’ve used 5 rolls of this last 2 pack shipment and I just had to go buy a different brand. The absorbency is sub par and the fact that they now leave fuzz on everything they come in contact with is the reason I’ve decided to go with a different brand. I will add that the price gouging on this product is mind blowing! I was paying $22 and checked the other day to find the same exact product price had risen to $54.50. Come on Amazon—-if you can suspend the account for “excessive returns” maybe you need to get quality control so you aren’t shipping out crap products that need to be returned! I’m seriously debating on renewing my membership next month.
', '
  I love being able to year off smaller squares!  I feel like I’m able to save money by not having to use a whole towel when it’s not necessary. Great napkin size too.
', '
  I purchased and received this item at a reasonable price of approximately $48. I checked this item again to re-order however the price is now $212.02. This is definitely price gouging in this current environment. The Federal and Provincial Government have indicated this is illegal.
']

Text:
["
  NOVEMBER 1, 2020 BUYER BEWARE!!I BOUGHT THESE SAME EXACT TOWELS ON 09/11/20 FOR $29.89  TAX CHARGED  1.79  TOTAL PAID  $31.68THEY ARE NOW SELLING FOR  $67.90  DO NOT PURCHASE!!!THEY WERE GREAT TOWELS AND THE ABILITY TO BE ABLE TO USE A QUARTER SHEET WAS AWESOME.  I WAS GOING TO PLACE AN ORDER FOR ANOTHER PACKAGE OF 16 TOWELS; BUT, I CERTAINLY WON'T BE DOING SO,  I'LL NOW MOST LIKELY RESORT BACK TO SCOTT PAPER TOWELS, WHICH I LOATHE, AS IT'S UNUSUAL TO BE ABLE TO TEAR A SHEET CLEANLY.  DO NOT BUY!!!  THEY WEREN'T THAT AWESOME OF A TOWEL!CYNTHIA A. FERGUSON
", '
  I have bought Brawny for years and like this tear a square option.  However, their quality is ridiculously bad all of a sudden.  The rolls are not tearing along the perforations as they are designed to do (and which they’ve done previously) and there is little more annoying than yanking your towel off the roll on the counter only to have it all come unspun or to rip in some random place.  I pay more for this brand than others and expect quality.  I called Georgia Pacific (manufacturer) and also emailed them.  I eventually got an email back with a case # asking for many specifics including UPC codes and proof of purchase which I provided in a response email.....never heard back.  A month or so later, I got a call back from my previous voice mail to them, with different case #, asking that I call back.  I called back and referenced the case number exactly as they requested and, again, never heard back.  Today, many weeks later, I got a form letter in the mail with a coupons for a free 6 pack (I purchased a 16 pack) up to $7 value.  And of course, there is no 6 pack option on amazon (where I purchased these) for less than $7, not to mention that it does not solve my complaint about the other 10 rolls in the 16 pack I originally purchased.  I would say, terrible quality, absolutely non existent customer service and an ultimately closed case on their end with a mailed coupon that does not even reimburse the quantity indicated on the coupon, meaning they want me to pay more money for the privilege of purchasing their defective and terrible quality product.  And as a consumer, I will always give my business to those companies who demonstrate a value for their consumers.  This company was not interested in a consumers experience with their product so they could correct some production line error.  Rather, they just wanted to send a form letter and some cheap generic coupon.  Sorry to tell you Georgia Pacific (Brawny), but Proctor and Gamble will get my next order....shame on you, taking advantage of people during a pandemic with shoddy, overpriced garbage!
', '
  It’s kind of weird writing a review about this item, but my feelings are so strong that I’m compelled.  I needed paper towel during a stay-at-home order, and with all the shortages, this is what I could find for delivery at the time.  I have to say, it really sucks compared to Bounty.  It’s just not nearly as strong and absorbent, and while I thought the quarter sheet idea was interesting in theory, it’s actually pretty dumb in reality.  It’s kind of hard to rip off a quarter quickly or with wet hands, and there are very few situations when I thought, “Boy, a half sheet just seems like too much!”  Mostly the extra perforations just make the towels fall apart when you’re trying to use them, which is super annoying.  So these were better than going without at a time when I didn’t want to risk contracting disease to battle a bunch of people for paper products at Target first thing in the morning, but I don’t plan on buying again if I can help it.
', '
  I have used Brawny for years and loved them. My most recent bulk shipment cost more than buying in the store and they fall apart  as I am cleaning.  I dont need anyone to rip my paper towel in half and then in quarters... i want the old sturdy Brawny that earned my business  Sadly this is not it.  I can rip it myself if i want to  But i cant heal the pieces that fall apart as i clean up spills.  Very unhappy with the price and the excessive perforations.
', '
  I did not realize that the usual select-a-size sheets tore in half until I got them! Ok so Brawny was already my favorite paper towel. This just took things to the next level.
', '
  We have used the Brawny Select A Size for a couple years.  I like the ability to use full or half size sheets.  So when I saw that we are now getting the quarter size option, I thought that maybe I would use it occasionally.  Boy, was I wrong.  Who knew how often the quarter size would get used - apparently the answer is lots and lots of times.  My teenage kids use 1 quarter sheet to put a sandwich on and the other quarter they use as a napkin.  I guess there’s no reason they couldn’t have done this with the unperforated half sheet and just torn it in half but they just used 2 half sheets then instead of 2 quarter sheets now.  I know it sounds kind of dumb, but we do eat a lot of sandwiches my house and this has really made a difference in reducing our paper towel usage.  I definitely recommend this item - you might be surprised how frequently the quarter sheet option is used.
', "
  Other people have complained about this.  They ordered BOUNTY but they were sent Brawny instead.  I think this happened to me.  In my opinion BOUNTY is the only good paper towes out there.  Brawny is smaller rolls. I suppose I have to use them, but next time I'm going to double check.
", "
  I bought these because of the four square design.  It might be nice if they were easy to tear there but it's not so no point.They're not worth the money.  This is way, way too expensive for paper towels and what you get.
", '
  I am so tired of buying cheap paper towels that end up being less then paper thin. But the thick ones usually cost more for less paper towel!Soooo happy with these! Good price, thick, durable, and have both a lengthwise cut and a widthwise fold.BRILLIANT!Have definitely recommended them
', '
  Great quality, I’m not disappointed at all. And I do appreciate the ability to easily tear of a quarter sheet rather than just a half sheet like most brands offer. It’s a New feature that I’ve never had, although have found myself doing often with other paper towels.I find the absorbency to be good. They’re not out-of-this-world but they are more than adequate and of decent value. Overall I’d say it’s a great buy.
', '
  I have used paper towels that could be separated lengthwise, but being able to also tear horizontally is new to me! Using only as much as you need, helps to reduce waste. The towels don’t leave “paper fuzz” on windows or mirrors. They absorb liquids very well and last longer than I would expect before more paper towel is needed. Amazon’s price was much better than our what I would pay in stores.
', "
  The idea is awesome and gets you sold instantly.Problem is the idea doesn't work, or it isn't done right.Once you start pulling it's like playing roulette; You don't know what size you're going to get. Is it going to be half of a square, or is it going to be one square and a half? Count yourself lucky if you actually get the square you're buying this thing for. Even getting just a regular sheet, or half a sheet is a pita.It was actually less effort to get my square when tearing half a bounty sheet.Did a quick, non scientific, absorption test and it's less than same size bountyI'm stuck with so many of them now!Don't waste your money. The idea is great, this product just didn't get it right.
"]
